question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Do you agree that black people can't be racist? Since only Africans were colonized, can they be racists?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

And black people don\u2019t have the power to enact systemic racism against others.", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "This might be true ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "within the context of a sociology class", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " where the term ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "racism", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " has been jargonized, but just because some academic sociologists decided to redefine a word for a narrow academic purpose doesn\u2019t mean that the rest of us have been wrong to use the term as it was understood before. Sociologists don\u2019t own the term. The word belongs to the English language. ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "Just because botanists decided to classify the tomato as a fruit doesn\u2019t mean the rest of us can\u2019t call it a vegetable when we\u2019re cooking", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": ".", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The world is not the United States, nor even the West as we understand it. To state that ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "blacks can\u2019t enact systemic oppression against whites", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " is to look at the entire history of the world through the history of the United States. ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "Note that this was after the revolution and completely unnecessary. ", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": "More recently, in my own Cote d\u2019Ivoire, there were massive anti-French riots led by machete-armed militia in 2003.
